intro: Oligostachyum gracilipes, commonly known as the slender bamboo, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces compact, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish flowers. Oligostachyum gracilipes is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
